title: Initial direction of charged particle motion

content.question: Three charged particles are near each other but isolated from other objects. Particle <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a charge of <math alttext="positive 2.0 microcoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and is located <math alttext="4.0 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>4.0 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> above the origin on the positive <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. Particle <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a charge of <math alttext="negative 4.0 microcoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and is located <math alttext="8.0 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>8.0 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> directly below particle <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Particles <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are fixed in place. Particle <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a charge of <math alttext="negative 1.0 microcoulomb" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>μ</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and is released from rest at <math alttext="3.0 centimeters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>3.0 cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from the origin on the positive <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. Which of the following shows the initial direction of motion of particle <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents am arrow which points upward and slightly to the right.
The figure presents an arrow which points upward and significantly to the right.
The figure presents an arrow which points downward and slightly to the left.
The figure presents an arrow which points upward and significantly to the left.

content.answer: The figure presents am arrow which points upward and slightly to the right.
